quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Team and Competition
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, retirement, budget. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In this year Wembley becomes the official host of the competition.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1923

questions.question: In 1992 this owner and President of the Milwaukee Brewers became Commissioner of Major League baseball.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Allan Selig

questions.question: In this year Welmbley ceases from being the official host of the Competition.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2000

questions.question: This side defeated Herbert Chapmans great Arsenal side 2-0 in 1933.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Walsall

questions.question: This company, with a huge ad budget in the world of sports, has a sports marketing division which creates advertising material for the Super Bowl.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anheuser-Busch

questions.question: Clubs from the top divisions and the Premier League join the competition at this stage.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Third Round

questions.question: This number of trophies have been in use during the competitions long history.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4

questions.question: The White Horse Final took place on this date.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 28 April 1923

questions.question: Stanley Matthews won his first Ever FA Trophy while on this team.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blackpool

questions.question: Who was appointed NFL Commissioner after the retirement of Paul Tagliabue?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roger Goodell

questions.question: In 2002 this man, who was President of Indiana University, became President of the NCAA.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Myles  Brand

questions.question: In 1978, Sir Bobby Robson wins his first FA Cup trophy as a manager of this team.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ipswich Town

questions.question: Beginning in 1998 he had a significant role in CBS getting the rights to NFL games through at least 2012. His father was a truly great sportscaster.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sean McManus

questions.question: Which team won the most  FA cups during the 1909-2005 period?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Manchester United

questions.question: The first FA Cup final took place on this date.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 16 March 1872

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Owner and Nfl
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, instructor, agents. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: He has been a fine Super Bowl-winning NFL coach, a football commentator and a video game icon.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Madden

questions.question: This family has had three starting NFL quarterbacks who have won at least two Super Bowls in a row.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Manning

questions.question: Who purchased the Dallas Cowboys in 1989?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jerry Jones

questions.question: He grew up in a suburb of Pittsburgh. In 2002 he became the owner of the Dallas Mavericks.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mark Cuban

questions.question: This basketball player, drafted by the Cleveland Cavaliers in 2003, is famous for doing commercials for Sprite, Nike, and Upper Deck.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: LeBron James

questions.question: The 2008 owner of the Seattle Seahawks and Portland Trailblazers was a co-founder of this company.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Microsoft

questions.question: He is one of the most influential sports agents in the NFL. His clients have included Steve Young, Troy Aikman, Warren Moon, and Kordell Stewart.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leigh Steinberg

questions.question: This prominent sports agent has represented some of the highest-paid baseball players, including
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Scott Boras

questions.question: He moved from running Radio City Music Hall to becoming CEO of The United States Tennis Association.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arlen Kantarian

questions.question: Malcolm Glazer purchased these two teams in 1995 and 2005 respectively.

options.text: Tampa Bay Buccaneers and Manchester United
Tampa Bay Buccaneers and Tampa Bay (Devil) Rays
New Orleans Saints and Charlote Hornets
Tampa Bay (Devil) Rays and New Orleans Saints

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tampa Bay Buccaneers and Manchester United

questions.question: He was born in 1987 and is considered one of the top player in his sport. He was nicknamed The Next One.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sidney Crosby

questions.question: In 1986 he became Executive Director of the Major League Baseball Players Association.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Donald Fehr

questions.question: He was a bellhop, an aerobics instructor and an amateur boxer. In 1992 he began the UFC for mixed  martial arts.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dana White

questions.question: He is known as the owner of the Boston Red Sox and Roush Fenway Racing.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Henry

questions.question: This agent has represented Yao Ming, Tracy McGrady, T.J. Ford, Ben Wallace, Jordan Farmar and Jermaine ONeal.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arn Tellum

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Thrasher and Issue
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, cubs, atlanta. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What was the name of the reader mail section of  monthly skateboarding magazine, Thrasher, in the 1980s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mail Drop

questions.question: This Texas artist drew the artwork for Zorlac skateboards and was a regular contributing artist for Thrasher magazine.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pushead

questions.question: Who was on the cover of the first issue of Transworld Skateboarding magazine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steve Caballero

questions.question: In the video, Searching for Animal Chin of successful skate team Bones Brigade, who was Animal Chin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The master of skateboarding

questions.question: In the 1980s Tony Hawks father, Frank Hawk was head of what organization?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The National Skateboard Association

questions.question: Who broke Hank Aarons career home run record?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Barry Bonds

questions.question: What was the previous name of the Chicago Cubs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chicago Colts

questions.question: What skateboard company switched their focus and skyrocketed to success with their clothing line in the mid eighties?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vision Street Wear

questions.question: In skateboarding, what is a Boneless one?

options.text: A classic trick, invented by Garry Scott Davis
A skater that doesnt like to fall
A skateboard without a nose guard
A fall that doesnt break anything

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A classic trick, invented by Garry Scott Davis

questions.question: Which of these became the Red Soxs home ballpark in 1912?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fenway Park

questions.question: He invented the aerial skateboarding trick, McTwist and first performed it in public in 1984 at the Del-Mar Skatepark contest.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mike McGill

questions.question: What was the name of the two brothers who were both professional skaters in the late 70s, then resurfaced in the 80s to become dominant riders once again?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steve and Mickey Alba

questions.question: What baseball team was founded in Manhattan in 1960?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York Mets

questions.question: Which of these is not one of the colors for the Atlanta Braves team uniforms?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Green

questions.question: This man, born in 1963 in New york, is the inventor of the ollie, a skateboarding move.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alan Gelfand

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Team and Game
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, leaguers, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What do these major leaguers have in common: Jim Bibby, Robin Roberts, Curt Simmons, and Woody Fryman?

options.text: They all hit winning homers in perfect games.
They were all losing pitchers in two perfect games.
They were all on the field for two perfect games.
They all pitched 27 consecutive outs but had perfect games foiled by the first batter.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They all pitched 27 consecutive outs but had perfect games foiled by the first batter.

questions.question: The first perfect game played in Calfornia was played in this city.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Los Angeles

questions.question: On October 13,1960, the Pirates got a homerun from Bill Mazeroski. What is significant about this homerun in baseball history?

options.text: It was the first walk off homerun in a World Series Game 7 that won the Series against the Yankees.
It completed the only hitting for a cycle in a World Series game winning the series for Pittsburgh in game 6.
It was the first Grand Slam in World Series history, winning Game 7 and the Series versus the Yankees.
It is the only inside the park homerun in a World Series Game that beat the Yankees in Game 5 of the World Series.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It was the first walk off homerun in a World Series Game 7 that won the Series against the Yankees.

questions.question: The Pirates were the first team in Major League history to field an all black starting lineup.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The Pittsburgh Pirates were a great team in baseballs early years. Unfortunately they lost the first modern World Series in 1903 to this team.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Boston Red Sox

questions.question: In 1917, a starting pitcher walked the first batter, was ejected and then the relief pitcher pitched perfectly for the rest of the game. Who was the ejected pitcher?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Babe Ruth

questions.question: In this movie, the protagonist pitched a perfect game in his first pro baseball game.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Scout

questions.question: Who was the first player to play in three perfect games?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul ONeil

questions.question: On May 26, 1959 this pitcher pitched 12 perfect innings.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harvey Haddix

questions.question: In 1909 the Pirates won their first World Series versus the Detroit Tigers. This same year they started playing in this Ball Park that would be their home until 1970.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Forbes Field

questions.question: This is the first team to win more than one perfect game.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yankees

questions.question: This  is the first team to have three perfect games pitched against them.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dodgers

questions.question: He was the first 40-year-old to pitch a perfect game.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Randy Johnson

questions.question: This famous actor/singer owned the Pittsburgh Pirates in the 1940s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bing Crosby

questions.question: Who was the first non-American born pitcher to pitch a perfect game?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dennis Martinez
